techmeme.title: Thomson Reuters acquires Michigan-based tax automation company SafeSend in an all-cash transaction valued at $600M (Paul Sawers/TechCrunch)
Apple to pay $95M to settle a lawsuit claiming Apple recorded private conversations when Siri was unintentionally activated and shared the data with advertisers (Jonathan Stempel/Reuters)
Sources: Morgan Stanley's E-Trade explores adding crypto trading, if approved by Federal Reserve, anticipating a favorable regulatory environment under Trump (Yueqi Yang/The Information)
Telegram rolls out a new account verification method powered by third-parties, new search filters for private chats, and the ability to turn gifts into NFTs (Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch)
Asus, Samsung, and MSI separately unveil the world's first 27-inch QD-OLED gaming monitors, offering 4K OLED at 240Hz, without sharing release dates or pricing (Tom Warren/The Verge)
